text: Hi, is there a way to export to HTML a makie plot ?  I currently use atom + markdown preview plus in Julia (using "Plotly" or "Plots") to create a full html text to insert into a webpace.   I used the save. command for "Makie" but I have not found any way to create a html from vectorized image (not png or pure image).

elements.text: Hi, is there a way to export to HTML a makie plot ?  I currently use atom + markdown preview plus in Julia (using "Plotly" or "Plots") to create a full html text to insert into a webpace.   I used the save. command for "Makie" but I have not found any way to create a html from vectorized image (not png or pure image).

text: A lot of makie's magic is implemented in Julia, and it's not trivial or possible to port it to Javascript. Plotly is Javascript based, that's why they can do a html export that runs as a standalone

elements.text: A lot of makie's magic is implemented in Julia, and it's not trivial or possible to port it to Javascript. Plotly is Javascript based, that's why they can do a html export that runs as a standalone

text: Wglmakie has rudimentary export, but it's not comparable

elements.text: Wglmakie has rudimentary export, but it's not comparable

text:
When using “Plots” I can save a vector
 graph to html:
open(path_to_file, “a”) do io
 show(io, “text/html”, p)
 close(file name)
 end
while in makie
 I use:
 scene.center = false
 save(“imageplot.png”, scene)
but this file is a pure image.
Is there any way for Makie
 to obtain a vector image so to use it
 as mathjax / html / markdown ?

elements.text:
When using “Plots” I can save a vector
 graph to html:
open(path_to_file, “a”) do io
 show(io, “text/html”, p)
 close(file name)
 end
while in makie
 I use:
 scene.center = false
 save(“imageplot.png”, scene)
but this file is a pure image.
Is there any way for Makie
 to obtain a vector image so to use it
 as mathjax / html / markdown ?

text: Do you mean that you want to save a .svg file?
